title: Jump Box
description: A jump server, jump host or jump box is a system on a network used to access and manage devices in a separate security zone. A jump server is a hardened and monitored device that spans two dissimilar security zones and provides a controlled means of access between them.
key-ideas: A single, security hardened system that is the only connection between a trusted/secured network and an untrusted network.
Should be the only device connected to the security zone with a connection to another network.
Preferred vs. firewalls when an operating system is needed to run specialize software that interacts directly with systems/appliances on the secure network area.
Increases security by reducing attack surface and reducing the amount of maintenance needed to keep secure.
